resources.description: This can be used to create a new tasks List . It is required to place the tasks list inside of a project
resources.name: Task List

resources.description:
This api comand can be used to get the list of tasks that are available in the tasks list. Each task have an id which could be used to view its detail . The tasks can be found in the items tag. 


"items": [
    {
      "@id": "http://localhost:8080/Core/project-list/test-project/test-task-list/the-first-task-for-this-user",
      "@type": "task",
      "description": "the task is to saffffsdgdsgsddgdsfsdf",
      "review_state": "published",
      "title": "The first task for this user"
    },
    {
      "@id": "http://localhost:8080/Core/project-list/test-project/test-task-list/copy_of_the-first-task-for-this-user",
      "@type": "task",
      "description": "the task is to saffffsdgdsgsddgdsfsdf",
      "review_state": "published",
      "title": "The second task for this user"
    }
  ],
resources.name: Task List

resources.description: The post comand can be used to create a new Porject content type. It is required to put the project content type in the project folder. Along with the name you can set the specific features that you would need on creation.
resources.name: Project

resources.description:
This is used to fetch the project details of a specific project from the list. 
The example project have the id of 

http://localhost:8080/Core/project-list/test-project

which is used. Each project have a name and the various details for the project. A project can also hold the content type cal Task List. This is the list of tasks in the project and the id of the tasks list can be used to get the tasks that are in the list.
resources.name: Project

resources.description:
This is used to get the list of the projects that are created by a spicific user in the system. They are between the item tags


"items": [
    {
      "@id": "http://localhost:8080/Core/project-list/test-project",
      "@type": "project",
      "description": "Project for tessting purposes",
      "review_state": "published",
      "title": "Test project"
    }
  ],
  
  
  each project would have an id which can be used to get the project details. An Example is test project with the id of 
  
  http://localhost:8080/Core/project-list/test-project
resources.name: Project List
